sen.j: 皇統譜は、皇室の身分関係（家族関係）を公証し、皇位継承の順序を定める基礎となる、皇室の戸籍にあたる。
sen.e: Kotofu is a family register of Imperial family which is a base to decide the order of succession to the Imperial Throne and to notarize the lineage relation (family relation) of Imperial family.

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）に定められた旧皇室典範には「皇統譜…ハ図書寮ニ於テ尚藏ス」（34条）と規定されるのみで、その詳細は明治初年以来宮中で行われていた皇室系図の取調べにおける内規により運用されていた。
sen.e: In Former Imperial House Law designated in 1889, there was only a regulation that 'Kotofu is... stored in Zushoryo (the Bureau of Drawings and Books),' (the thirty-fourth article), the detailed was carried by the bylaw in the investigation of Imperial family's genealogy done in the Imperial court since the first year of Meiji period.

In the Former Imperial Household Law established in 1889, there was only a regulation that "Kotofu... is to be stored in Zushoryo (the Bureau of Drawings and Books)" (Article 34), and details were carried according to bylaw of the investigation of Imperial Family's genealogy which had been done in the Imperial court since the first year of Meiji period.

sen.j: 1926年（大正15年）に至り、皇統譜令の取扱いを整備することとなり、皇統譜令（大正15年皇室令第6号、旧皇統譜令）を定めた。
sen.e: In 1926 the treatment of the order of Kotofu was streamlined and the order of Kotofu (Koshitsu-rei (the Imperial Families' Act) the six issue in 1926, the old order of Kotofu) was designated.

In 1926 the management of Kotofu Rei (literally, the Order of the Record of Imperial Lineage) was improved, and the Kotofu Rei (Order of the Record of Imperial Lineage) (Koshitsu Rei [literally, Imperial House Act] No.6 of 1926, the previous Order of the Record of Imperial Lineage) was enacted.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦後、日本国憲法の施行にあたり、皇室典範（昭和22年法律第3号）は法律として、皇統譜令（昭和22年5月3日政令第1号）は政令として新たに制定された。
sen.e: After the World War II when the Constitution of Japan was enforced, Imperial House Law (the law the third article in 1947) as a law and the order of Kotofu as a government ordinance were newly established.

After the World War II, upon enforcement of the Constitution of Japan, the Imperial House Act (Act No.3 of 1947) as a law and the Order of the Record of Imperial Lineage (government ordinance No.1 of May 3, 1947) as a government ordinance were newly enacted, respectively.

sen.j: 皇統譜には原本と副本があり、原本は宮内庁に、副本は法務省に保管することが皇統譜令で定められている。
sen.e: Kotofu has an original book and the subsidiary book and the order of Kotofu designated that the original should be stored in the Imperial Household Agency and the subsidiary be in Ministry of Justice.

Kotofu exists in two copies, the original copy and the counterpart (duplicate copy), and the Order of the Record of Imperial Lineage stipulates that the original should be stored in the Imperial Household Agency and the counterpart in the Ministry of Justice.

sen.j: 現行の皇室典範および皇統譜令には、「皇統譜」との記述しかない。
sen.e: In the existing Imperial House Act and the order of Kotofu, only 'Kotofu' is described.
In the present Imperial House Act and the Order of Imperial Lineage, the single term 'Kotofu' alone is shown.

sen.j: しかし、皇統譜には、大統譜（たいとうふ）と皇族譜（こうぞくふ）があり、大統譜には天皇・皇后・皇太后の身分に関する事項が、皇族譜にはその他の皇族の身分に関する事項が登録される。
sen.e: However in Kotofu there are Taitofu and Kozokufu and in Taitofu the entry on Emperor, Empress and Empress Dowager is registered, and in Kozokufu the entry on status of the other Imperial families is registered.

However, the Kotofu consists of the Taitofu and the Kozokufu, and the Taitofu registers entries concerning statuses of Emperor, Empress and Empress Dowager, whereas the Kozokufu registers entries concerning statuses of the other Imperial Family members.

sen.j: 大統譜には歴代の天皇が登録され、首部には天照大神に至る神代の系譜も登録される。
sen.e: In Taitofu the successive Emperors are registered and in the introduction the genealogy of age of the gods leading to Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) is registered.
In addition, the Taitofu registers the successive Emperors, the beginning part of which includes the genealogy of the age of gods traced back to Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess).

sen.e: The whole sentences in Kotofu can be consulted if, based on the law concerning the disclosure of information owned by an administrative agency, asking the Imperial Household Agency.

The full text of the Kotofu are available for inspection by any person upon request which should be submitted to the Imperial Household Agency according to the Act on Access to Information Held by Administrative Organs.

sen.j: 旧皇統譜令
sen.e: Former order of Kotofu.
Kyu Kotofu Rei (literally, the previous Order of the Record of Imperial Lineage)
Kyu Kotofu Rei (literally, the previous Order of the Record of Imperial Lineage)

sen.j: 旧皇統譜令とは、現行皇統譜令の制定前に施行されていた皇統譜令（大正15年皇室令第6号）である。
sen.e: Former order of Kotofu refers to the order of Kotofu (Koshitsu-rei (the Imperial Families' Act) the sixth issue in 1926) which had been enforced before the establishment of the existing order of Kotofu.
The Kyu Kotofu Rei refers to Kotofu Rei (Koshitsu Rei No.6 of 1926) which had been enforced before enactment of the existing Kotofu Rei.
sen.cmt: 用語・形式を修正しました
sen.e: The Kyu Kotofu Rei refers to Kotofu Rei (Koshitsu Rei No.6 of 1926) which had been enforced before enactment of the existing Kotofu Rei.

sen.j: 皇室令及附属法令廃止ノ件（昭和22年皇室令第12号）により廃止されたが、現行皇統譜令は第1条で「この政令に定めるものの外、皇統譜に関しては、当分の間、なお従前の例による」との経過規定を置き、皇統譜の詳細に関しては旧皇統譜令の定めを準用する。
sen.e: Through the abolishment of Koshitsu-rei and the subsidiary laws and ordinances (Koshitsu-rei the twelfth issue in 1947) the former order of Kotofu was abolished, but in the first article of the existing order of Kotofu, there was a process regulation that 'concerning Kotofu, except for what this act designates, for the time being, the cases depend on the previous examples, and concerning the details on Kotofu, the old order of Kotofu was used.

The Kyu Kotofu Rei was repealed based on "Koshitsu rei oyobi fuzoku horei haishi no ken" (literally, repeal of Koshitsu Rei and the subordinate laws and ordinances (Koshitsu Rei No.12 of 1947), but Article 1 of the existing Kutofu Rei is a progress provision stipulating that "any matters concerning Kotofu, except for those stipulated by this government ordinance, shall, for the time being, comply with precedents," and thus, detailed rules stipulated in the Kyu Kotofu Rei applies mutatis mutandis to the existing Kotofu.
sen.cmt: 用語・表現・形式を修正しました。「附属法令」の示す内容が「附則」である場合はsupplementary provisionsとなり、「条例」である場合は(local) bylaws となります。ご確認願います。なお、後項原文は分断された文章後半部分でしたので、当該文章と統合し、後列一列を削除しました。
sen.e: The Kyu Kotofu Rei was repealed based on "Koshitsu rei oyobi fuzoku horei haishi no ken" (literally, repeal of Koshitsu Rei and the subordinate laws and ordinances (Koshitsu Rei No.12 of 1947), but Article 1 of the existing Kutofu Rei is a progress provision stipulating that "any matters concerning Kotofu, except for those stipulated by this government ordinance, shall, for the time being, comply with precedents," and thus, detailed rules stipulated in the Kyu Kotofu Rei applies mutatis mutandis to the existing Kotofu.

sen.j: 旧皇統譜令の定めと現行皇統譜令の定めの異同は、以下の通り。
sen.e: The difference of the orders of the old and existing Kotofu is as follows.
Difference in rules between the old and new Kotofu is as follows.
Difference in rules between the old and new Kotofu is as follows.

sen.j: 皇統譜令の副本は、旧令では「内大臣府」で保管すると定めたが（旧2条2項）、現行令では「法務省」でこれを保管すると定めた（現2条）。
sen.e: The duplicate copy of the order of Kotofu was designated to be stored in 'Minister of Interior's Office' in the old order (the old second article the section two), but in the existing order it was designated to be stored in 'Ministry of Justice' (the existing second article).

The duplicate copy of the Kotofu Rei was to be retained by 'Naidaijin-fu' (Office of Minister of the Center) as prescribed in the old Kotofu Rei (the old Article 2, Paragraph 2), while in the existing Kotofu Rei it was to be retained by 'Ministry of Justice' (the existing Article 2).
sen.cmt: 用語・表現・形式を修正しました
sen.e: The duplicate copy of the Kotofu Rei was to be retained by 'Naidaijin-fu' (Office of Minister of the Center) as prescribed in the old Kotofu Rei (the old Article 2, Paragraph 2), while in the existing Kotofu Rei it was to be retained by 'Ministry of Justice' (the existing Article 2).

sen.j: 「公布又は公告がない事項の登録」については、旧令では「勅裁」を経て行うと定めたが（旧4条）、現行令では「宮内庁長官が、法務大臣と協議して、これを行う」と定めた（現3条1号）。
sen.e: As for 'the registration of items without publication or announcement,' the old order designated that they were done after 'imperial decision' (the old fourth article), but the existing order designated that 'the Grand Steward of the Imperial Household Agency negotiate with Minister of Justice and do this' (the existing third article the first issue).

As for 'register of items without publication or announcement,' the old Kotofu Rei stipulated that it be done after grant of an 'imperial decision' (the old Article 4), whereas the existing Kotofu Rei stipulates that 'the Grand Steward of the Imperial Household Agency negotiate with Minister of Justice and carry out the said registration of items' (the existing Article 3, Item 1).
sen.cmt: 用語・表現・形式を修正しました
sen.e: As for 'register of items without publication or announcement,' the old Kotofu Rei stipulated that it be done after grant of an 'imperial decision' (the old Article 4), whereas the existing Kotofu Rei stipulates that 'the Grand Steward of the Imperial Household Agency negotiate with Minister of Justice and carry out the said registration of items' (the existing Article 3, Item 1).

sen.j: 「皇統譜の登録又は附記に錯誤を発見した場合の訂正」は、旧令では「皇族会議及枢密院 (日本)ノ諮詢」および「勅裁」を経て行うと定めたが（旧5条1項2項）、現行令では「宮内庁長官が、法務大臣と協議して、これを行う」と定めた（現3条2号）。
sen.e: As for 'the correction of registration or additional statement in the case that the mistakes were found,' the old order designated that 'Imperial family meeting and Privy Council (Japan) would ask for it' or through 'Imperial decision' (the old fifth article the first and second item), but the existing order designated that 'the Grand Steward of the Imperial Household Agency negotiate with Minister of Justice and do this' (the existing third article the second issue).

As for 'correction of entries or additional entries in the Record in case of detecting any errors,' the old Kotofu Rei stipulated that it be done based on 'advisories from Imperial Household Council and Privy Council (Japan)' and 'Imperial decision' (the old Article 5, Paragraphs 1-2 inclusive,) whereas the existing Kotofu Rei stipulates that 'the Grand Steward of the Imperial Household Agency negotiate with Minister of Justice and carry out the said correction' (the existing Article 3, Item 2).

sen.j: 皇嗣に、不治の重患または重大な事故があるために、皇位継承の順序を変えたときの登録に関しては、新旧令に大きな違いはない（旧28条、現4条）。
sen.e: When Crown Prince has a fatal disease or a big accident and the order of succession to the Imperial Throne was changed, there is not a big difference concerning the registration between the old and new order (the old twenty-eighth article, the existing fourth article.)

As for register in the case where the order of succession to the Imperial Throne was changed due to Crown Prince's fatal disease or serious accident, there is no major difference between the old and new Kotofu Rei (the old Article 28, the existing Article 4).

sen.e: As for register in the case where the order of succession to the Imperial Throne was changed due to Crown Prince's fatal disease or serious accident, there is no major difference between the old and new Kotofu Rei (the old Article 28, the existing Article 4).

sen.j: 親王、内親王、王 (皇族)又は女王 (皇族)が、皇族の身分を離れたときの登録に関しても、新旧令に大きな違いはない（旧31条、32条、34条、現5条）。
sen.e: As for the registration when Imperial Prince, Imperial Princess, Emperor (Imperial family) or Empress (Imperial family) left the status of Imperial family, there is no big difference between the new and old order (the old thirty-first, thirty-second and thirty-fourth article, the existing fifth article.)

As for register in the case where Shinno (Imperial Prince), Naishinno (Imperial Princess), O (male member of the Imperial Family) or Nyo-o (female member of the Imperial Family) left the status of the Imperial family, there is no major difference between the new and old Kotofu Rei (the old Articles 31-32 and 34, the existing Article 5).

sen.j: 旧令では皇統譜の持ち出しに関しては定めていないが、現行令では内閣総理大臣の承認を得た場合に限って、尚蔵の部局外に持ち出すことを認めた（現6条）。
sen.e: Taking out of Kotofu was not stated in the old order, but in the existing order it was approved to be brought out of the department of Kuranokami (director of Zoshi) only in the case that the prime minister gave the approval (the existing sixth article).

The old Kotofu Rei did not regulate external use of the Kotofu, while the existing Kotofu Rei permits use of the Kutofu outside the Department of Kuranokami (which also read Shozo, referring to Lady of the Storehouse and Director of Zoshi) only when the prime minister approves of it (the existing Article 6).

sen.j: 皇統譜、戸籍、公職選挙法との関係
sen.e: The relationship with Kotofu, family register and Public Offices Election Act.
The relationship among Kotofu, family register and Public Offices Election Act
The relationship among Kotofu, family register and Public Offices Election Act

sen.j: 以上のとおり、天皇及び皇族の身分関係に関する事項は皇統譜令に基づく皇統譜に登録されるため、天皇及び皇族は戸籍法の適用を受けない。
sen.e: As mentioned above, the entries concerning Emperor and the social status relation of Imperial families are registered in Kotofu based on the order of Kotofu, and thus the Family Registration Law is not applied to Emperor and Imperial families.

As mentioned above, entries concerning statuses of the Emperor and of members of the Imperial family are registered in the Kotofu according to the Kotofu Rei, and thus the Family Registration Law is not applied to Emperors and members of the Imperial family.
sen.cmt: 用語・表現を修正しました
sen.e: As mentioned above, entries concerning statuses of the Emperor and of members of the Imperial family are registered in the Kotofu according to the Kotofu Rei, and thus the Family Registration Law is not applied to Emperors and members of the Imperial family.

sen.j: この点、公職選挙法附則2項に「戸籍法…の適用を受けない者の選挙権及び被選挙権は、当分の間、停止する」と定められているため、天皇及び皇族の選挙権及び被選挙権は、同法の規定によって当分の間停止されていることになるとする俗説がある。
sen.e: Regarding this point, in the second section of supplementary provision of Public Offices Election Act, it is written that 'the right to vote and eligibility of those who are not covered by the Family Registration Law are stopped for the time being,' and thus the right to vote and eligibility of Emperor and Imperial families are stopped for the time being by the regulation of the law, which is a vulgar belief.

In this regard, Paragraph 2 of Supplementary Provision of the Public Offices Election Act prescribes that 'suffrage and eligibility for election with respect to those who do not fall under the provisions of... the Family Registration Law are to be suspended for the time being,' hence a vulgar belief that the right to vote and eligibility for election of Emperor and members of the Imperial family have been suspended for the time being according to the above-mentioned provision of the Public Offices Election Act.
sen.cmt: 用語・表現を修正しました。後項原文は当該文章の続きが無意味に分割されたものでしたので、当該文章に統合し、空欄になった後項1行を削除しました。
sen.e: In this regard, Paragraph 2 of Supplementary Provision of the Public Offices Election Act prescribes that 'suffrage and eligibility for election with respect to those who do not fall under the provisions of... the Family Registration Law are to be suspended for the time being,' hence a vulgar belief that the right to vote and eligibility for election of Emperor and members of the Imperial family have been suspended for the time being according to the above-mentioned provision of the Public Offices Election Act.

sen.j: しかし、同法にいう戸籍法の適用を受けない者とは、本島人ノ戸籍ニ関スル件（昭和8年1月20日台湾総督府令第8号）又は朝鮮戸籍令（大正11年12月18日朝鮮総督府令第154号）の適用を受ける者、要するに公職選挙法施行当時に日本国籍を有していた台湾人や朝鮮人のことである。
sen.e: However, those who are not covered by the Family Registration Law according to Public Offices Election Act are those who are covered by the entry concerning the family register of people in the main island of Taiwan (the order of Taiwan Sotoku-fu the eighth issue in January 20, 1933) and the order of Korea family register (the order of Korea Sotoku-fu the one hundred fifty-fourth issue in December 18, 1922), that is, Taiwanese or Korean who had Japanese nationality when Public Offices Election Act was enforced.

However, when it comes to those who do not fall under the provisions of the Family Registration Law according to the Public Offices Election Act, they are those who fall under the provisions of the item concerning family register of people in the main island (Taiwan Sotoku-fu [Governor-General] Rei Ordinance No.8 of January 20, 1933) or of Korea family register (Chosen Sotoku-fu Rei Ordinance No.154 of December 18, 1922), that is, they are Taiwanese or Korean persons who had Japanese nationality when Public Offices Election Act was enforced.
sen.cmt: 表現・用語・形式を修正しました
sen.e: However, when it comes to those who do not fall under the provisions of the Family Registration Law according to the Public Offices Election Act, they are those who fall under the provisions of the item concerning family register of people in the main island (Taiwan Sotoku-fu [Governor-General] Rei Ordinance No.8 of January 20, 1933) or of Korea family register (Chosen Sotoku-fu Rei Ordinance No.154 of December 18, 1922), that is, they are Taiwanese or Korean persons who had Japanese nationality when Public Offices Election Act was enforced.

sen.j: 天皇及び皇族の選挙権・被選挙権は、象徴的な立場にある天皇とその一家として「政治的な立場も中立でなければならない」という要請や、天皇は「国政に関する権能を有しない」（憲法4条1項）という規定の趣旨などを根拠として、有していないとされているのであり、公職選挙法の規定が根拠になるわけではないと解されている。
sen.e: The right to vote and eligibility of Emperor and Imperial families, who are in a symbolic position, 'must be neutral in a political position,' upon request and Emperor 'can not have the capacity and power concerning national administration,' (Constitution the fourth article the first section), and thus they are considered not to have the right to vote and eligibility and it is interpreted not to be because of the regulation of Public Offices Election Act as a ground.

Since the Emperor and members of the Imperial Family, who are in a symbolic position, 'are required to be politically neutral,' and the Emperor 'shall not have powers related to government' (Article 4, Paragraph 1 of the Constitution), they are not allowed to have suffrage and eligibility for election, and it is understood that the provisions of the Public Offices Election Act do not provide grounds for that.
